Posts.Content: On May 31, 2013 8:08 PM gmaclf wrote: On Feb 03, 2013 3:53 AM mmilas wrote: I have been on Arimidex for 3 and a half years. I was wondering if this can cause high blood pressure and glucose problems. I have been taking Anastrozole (Arimidex) for approximately 13 months. I have NEVER had a high blood pressure reading...usually, 128/78-130/80. While at my gynecologist's office for an office visit, my b/p reading was 180/90...taken a second time to confirm. My gynecologist advised me to see my internist who was shocked to see the same reading of 180/90. Also...at my dental visit, the hygienist took my b/p and was shocked to see a very high reading. I had not associated this elevated b/p reading with taking Arimidex until a few weeks ago. It seems highly likely, though, that these very high b/p readings can be related to the medication. Also, high glucose readings which I have never encountered throughout my life. Hopefully, this will help in your own evaluation of what may be occuring with your b/p and glucose readings...VirginiaHello Virginia, I was just recently put on Arimidex after being diagnosed with Stage 1 - invasive lobular carcinoma. After a mastectomy and removal of "speck" of cancer with no lymph node involvement, I wonder the same. Blood pressure and blood sugar are slowly rising and it scares me. Will all the things this drug does to me kill me faster than that cancer ever would? How many more drugs will I have to take to counter act it's effects? The oncologist says it's my choice but I have to wonder if this isn't their standard procedure because this is what they do - give cancer meds. Every morning, I feel worse and worse when I get out of bed and only start to feel somewhat normal toward the end of the day (when it's time to take the drug again). The oncologist says taking this drug will give me a 10% greater chance of keeping the cancer at bay. Seems excessive to me and I don't think that number is accurate. Again, I feel like she is "pushing" unnecessarily because that is her job. I am hating what's happening to my quality of life - along with all the extra aging factors that will come with this eventually. I am 64 and every day feel older and older. Just don't know what to think or feel anymore either.
